required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reliability of Fluorescent Camera in Diagnosis of Occlusal Carious Lesion
clinical_study.official_title: Reliability of Fluorescent Camera and Caries Detection Dye Versus Visual- Assessment in Diagnosis of Occlusal Carious Lesion in Adult Patients: Invivo Diagnostic Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study will be conducted to compare the diagnostic predictive values of a light induced fluorescence camera and Caries detection dye versus visual assessment method in identification of occlusal carious lesion.

detailed_description.textblock: A total of 43 volunteer patients will be assigned in this study. Each patient must have at least two occlusal carious lesions. Each lesion will be evaluated by three diagnostic methods (D), where D1 represents light induced fluorescence camera, D2 represents Caries detection dye. And D3 represents visual assessment method (ICDAS criteria)

primary_outcome.measure: Reliability and level of agreement between operators for all diagnostic methods.
primary_outcome.description: It will be assessed using reliability & reproducibility by kappa strength measuring unit

arm_group.description: Light induced fluorescence camera Caries detection dye. visual assessment method (ICDAS criteria)

study_pop.textblock: Adult populations suffering from occlusal caries.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients should be over 18 Years old
- Patient should have good oral hygiene and general health
- patients With at least 2 non-cavitated first and/or second molar teeth in each quadrant of maxilla or mandible
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known allergy to any component of the dyes used.
- Patients having caries at proximal, buccal, lingual surface.
- Previously placed sealants or restorations.
- Bruxism or malocclusion

overall_official.affiliation: Conservative Dentistry Department, Faculty of Oral and Dental Medicine, Cairo University, Egypt.

overall_contact.last_name: shimaa M Zenhom Abd El Rahman, B A
